# Tali AI - Healthcare Documentation Solution Research

*Research Date: November 2025*

---

## Executive Summary

Tali AI is a Toronto-based healthcare AI company founded in 2020, specializing in ambient clinical documentation and AI-powered medical dictation. The company has differentiated itself through Canadian market focus, bilingual French/English support, and competitive pricing for small-to-medium practices. Recently selected as a pre-qualified vendor for Canada Health Infoway's AI Scribe Program, Tali is expanding into the U.S. market through strategic partnerships.

---

## 1. Website Research

### Current Product Offerings

| Product | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Ambient Scribe** | AI-powered ambient documentation that listens to patient visits and generates structured SOAP notes in minutes |
| **Medical Dictation** | Voice-to-text transcription with medical terminology support, 3x faster than typing |
| **Medical Search** | Voice-enabled medical information lookup with evidence-based answers |
| **EHR Assistant** | Voice commands for EMR navigation (currently OSCAR/OSCAR Pro) |

### Ambient Documentation Features

- **Real-time transcription** using advanced NLP and ASR (Automated Speech Recognition)
- **SOAP note generation** from patient-physician conversations
- **Customizable templates** for different specialties and documentation styles
- **Bilingual support** - English and French (Canadian French speakers)
- **Multilingual expansion** - Now supports 28 languages including Spanish, Mandarin, Punjabi, Arabic, and Farsi
- **Cross-platform** - Web, Windows desktop, Mac desktop, Chrome extension
- **Medical terminology recognition** - Trained on hundreds of hours of medical audio with diverse accents
- **Abbreviation expansion** - Auto-expands common healthcare terms (BP, CBC, COPD, MI, etc.)

### Pricing Information

| Plan | Price | Features |
|------|-------|----------|
| **Free** | $0 | 5 AI Scribes/month, 60 minutes dictation |
| **Premium** | $45/month (billed annually) | Unlimited dictation |
| **Pro** | $135/month (billed annually) | Unlimited AI Scribes + dictation |
| **Enterprise** | Custom pricing | Customized features, team collaboration |

*Note: Significantly lower than competitors like Nuance DAX (~$500-700/month) or DeepScribe (~$667/month)*

### Customer Case Studies

**Dr. Madhu Azad (Superior FHO, Thunder Bay, Ontario)**
> "Tali creates more trust between me and my patients... it currently saves me around one hour and 20 minutes a day. I no longer work outside of my clinic."

**Dr. Essam Saad**
> "Tali changed my practice, made work much easier, and gave me an exponential amount of time to focus on patient care rather than writing notes!"

**Dr. David Smyth**
> "Tali is integrated into my EMR and it saves me two hours per day."

**Dr. Matthew Brett**
> "Life changing, paradigm shifting and can't live without it."

**Measured Outcomes:**
- Saves up to 15 hours per month (some report 20+ hours)
- Cuts after-hours charting significantly
- Ranked **top 1% in accuracy and quality** by U.S. Veterans Affairs

---

## 2. KLAS Research

### Ratings and Reviews

**Status: Not yet formally rated by KLAS Research**

Tali AI does not appear in KLAS Research's vendor measurement program as of November 2025. This is common for smaller/emerging vendors and Canadian-focused companies. KLAS typically prioritizes vendors with significant U.S. enterprise healthcare market presence.

### Comparison to Larger Competitors

| Factor | Tali AI | Nuance DAX | Abridge | DeepScribe |
|--------|---------|------------|---------|------------|
| **KLAS Rating** | Not rated | Best in KLAS (historical) | Best in KLAS 2025 Ambient AI | Not rated |
| **Target Market** | SMB practices, Canada | Large health systems | Large health systems | Mid-market, oncology |
| **Pricing** | $45-135/month | $500-700/month | Enterprise pricing | ~$667/month |
| **Human QA** | No | Yes | Limited | Yes |
| **Epic Integration** | No | Deep | "First Pal" Partner | Yes |
| **French Support** | Native Canadian French | Limited | Limited | Limited |

---

## 3. General Research

### Company Profile

| Attribute | Details |
|-----------|---------|
| **Founded** | 2020 |
| **Headquarters** | 95 Danforth Avenue, Toronto, Ontario, Canada |
| **Co-Founders** | Hesam Dadafarin, Mahshid Yassaei (CEO) |
| **Stage** | Seed |
| **Employee Count** | Estimated 20-50 (not publicly disclosed) |
| **Origin** | Started as voice-enabled COVID Q&A chatbot for healthcare professionals |

### Funding History

| Round | Date | Amount | Lead Investors |
|-------|------|--------|----------------|
| Seed Round 1 | April 2022 | Undisclosed | MaRS Investment Accelerator Fund |
| Seed Round 2 | November 2023 | Undisclosed | Esplanade Ventures, TMV |
| Strategic Investment | 2021 | $1,000,000 | WELL Health |

**Total Investors (8):**
- Esplanade Healthtech Ventures
- TMV (Trail Mix Ventures)
- WELL Health / WELL Ventures
- DigiTx Partners
- MaRS Investment Accelerator Fund
- Google for Startups
- Innovation Solutions Canada (government)

**Government Support:**
- Part of Health Compass II project (Vancouver-based AI healthcare hub) - $15M+ federal funding allocation

### Technology Stack

**Speech Recognition:**
- Proprietary ASR trained on diverse Canadian accents
- French speech recognition trained specifically on Canadian French speakers
- Hundreds of hours of medical terminology training data

**AI/ML Components:**
- Natural Language Processing (NLP) for medical terminology
- Generative AI for SOAP note creation
- Custom medical language models
- No claim of fully proprietary LLM - likely uses hybrid approach with foundation models

**Architecture:**
- Cloud-based SaaS platform
- EHR-agnostic design ("layer on top of EHR")
- SMART on FHIR integration support
- Chrome extension and native desktop apps

**Privacy Stance:**
- HIPAA compliant (U.S.)
- PIPEDA compliant (Canada federal)
- PHIPA compliant (Ontario)
- PIPA compliant (BC/Alberta)
- SOC 2 Type 2 certified
- Data residency options available
- All data encrypted in transit and at rest

### Clinical Capabilities

| Capability | Status |
|------------|--------|
| Ambient documentation | GA |
| Medical dictation | GA |
| SOAP note generation | GA |
| Medical search/Q&A | GA |
| Voice commands in EMR | GA (OSCAR only) |
| Billing codes | Roadmap 2025 |
| Automatic form filling | Roadmap 2025 |
| AI suggestions/assistant | Roadmap 2025 |
| Task management | Roadmap 2025 |

### EHR Integrations

**Deep Integrations (SMART Launch):**
- OSCAR / OSCAR Pro
- TELUS Health CHR (Collaborative Health Record)
- Med Access
- Accuro (via QHR Marketplace - July 2025)

**Integration Types:**
1. SMART Launch (embedded in EHR)
2. Copy/paste (universal)
3. Chrome extension
4. Desktop application overlay

**Notable Gaps:**
- No Epic integration (major limitation for U.S. enterprise market)
- No Cerner/Oracle integration
- Limited MEDITECH support

### Geographic Focus

**Primary Market: Canada**
- Selected for Canada Health Infoway's AI Scribe Program (June 2025)
- Up to 10,000 one-year licenses for eligible clinicians
- OntarioMD AI Scribe Pilot participant
- WELL Health white-label partnership (21,000+ physicians network)

**Secondary Market: United States**
- U.S. Veterans Affairs AI Tech Sprint cohort participant
- Ranked top 1% in VA note accuracy evaluation
- Net Health partnership (October 2024) - specialty EHRs:
  - Optima (post-acute/senior living)
  - ReDoc (hospital outpatient)
  - TherapySource (physical therapy)
  - WoundExpert (wound care)

### Health System Customers

**Canada:**
- WELL Health clinics network (largest outpatient clinic operator in Canada)
- Canada Health Infoway program participants
- OntarioMD pilot clinics

**United States:**
- U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (pilot/evaluation)
- Net Health customer base (pending integration rollout)
- Individual practices and small groups

*Note: Tali's customer base is primarily individual physicians and small-to-medium practices rather than large health systems.*

### Differentiation Strategy

**1. Canadian Market Leadership**
- Only major AI scribe with native Canadian French support
- Trained on Canadian accents and dialects
- Compliant with Canadian privacy regulations (PIPEDA, PHIPA, PIPA)
- Strategic government program participation

**2. Price Point**
- 3-10x cheaper than enterprise competitors
- Free tier available for evaluation
- Accessible to solo practitioners and small practices

**3. Bilingual/Multilingual**
- French-English bilingual from inception
- Now 28 languages supported
- French and Farsi "outperform alternatives in accuracy"

**4. Simplicity**
- Works with any EHR via copy/paste
- No complex enterprise implementation
- Quick self-service onboarding

**5. Physician-Centric Design**
- Voice-enabled medical search differentiator
- Designed for dictation-heavy workflows
- Mobile-friendly

### 2025-2026 Roadmap

**Confirmed 2025 Features (from Tali website):**
- Billing Codes (ICD-10, CPT suggestions)
- Automatic Form Filling
- AI Assistant (contextual suggestions)
- Additional EMR Integrations
- Task Management

**Strategic Initiatives:**
- Canada Health Infoway AI Scribe Program launch (June 2025)
- Net Health integration rollout (U.S. specialty care)
- QHR/Accuro marketplace expansion (July 2025)
- 20+ additional language support

**2026 Outlook:**
- Continued U.S. market expansion via partnerships
- Net Health NEXT 2026 conference (Phoenix, April 2026) - likely integration showcase
- Potential additional funding round for U.S. growth

---

## Competitive Positioning

### Strengths
- Dominant Canadian market position with government backing
- Aggressive pricing makes it accessible to underserved SMB segment
- Bilingual French/English - no competitor matches this for Canadian market
- Strong physician testimonials and documented time savings
- SOC 2 Type 2 + multi-jurisdiction privacy compliance

### Weaknesses
- No Epic/Cerner integration limits U.S. enterprise opportunity
- Seed-stage funding vs. well-capitalized competitors ($60M-$800M+ raised)
- No KLAS rating/validation
- Limited "beyond ambient" capabilities (no coding, CDI, prior auth)
- Small team may struggle to scale enterprise support

### Opportunities
- Canada Health Infoway program could drive 10,000+ new users
- U.S. specialty care market via Net Health partnership
- Quebec market (25,000+ physicians) underserved by competitors
- Expansion to other Canadian EMRs

### Threats
- Major U.S. vendors (Nuance, Abridge) expanding Canadian operations
- Epic "Art for Clinicians" native ambient AI
- WELL Health could choose to build/buy alternative
- Canadian government funding changes
